newsitem.title: USA: International Paper unit begins tender offer.
newsitem.headline: International Paper unit begins tender offer.

text.p: International Paper's subsidiary Federal Paper Board said Wednesday it begun a tender offer to buy any and all of its 10-percent debentures due April 15, 2011.

The price to be paid for the debentures will be determined during the tender period by reference to a fixed spread of 55 basis points over the yield to maturity of 6 5/8 percent U.S. Treasury Notes due May 2007 at the time of acceptance of the tender offer, plus accrued and unpaid interest from the last regular payment of semi-annual interest to, but not including, the applicable settlement date.
The tender offer will expire on August 6, unless extended.
All debentures tendered in the tender offer will be bought upon the terms and subject to the conditions of the tender offer.
J.P. Morgan Securities Inc s the dealer manager for the tender offer, and D.F. King & Co Inc is the information agent.
